results.title: Eternity and a day = Mia Eoniotita ke mia mira
results.creator_credit: Theo Angelopoulos, Phoebe Economopoulos, Greek Film Centre, Greek Television, Intermedias, La Sept Cinema and Paradis Films
results.brief_description: Bruno Ganz plays Alexander, a famous author reaching the end of his life. On the eve of going into hospital he encounters a young Albanian refugee boy who is one of the thousands of illegal immigrants from Eastern Europe coming into Greece. Alexander begins a quest to return the boy home, and when that proves impossible, attempts to give the young orphan the security and opportunities unavailable on the streets. All the while his thoughts take him back into the past, where he attempts to make amends for his, at times, indifferent treatment of his wife, his child, and his mother. The voyage of the poet and the young boy culminates in a magical bus ride through Balkan history where Alexander comes to understand both the futility of one individual’s acts in affecting history, as well as finally understanding the true worth of a poet’s words. Angelopoulos’ languid and mesmerising mise-en-scene, combined with his passion for a cinema of intellectual commitment, has made him one of Europe’s premier contemporary artists of the transcendant. Features a beautiful score by Eleni Karaindrou. “Eternity and a Day” won the Palme d’Or at the 1998 Cannes Film Festival.

results.title: Mr Robinson Crusoe
results.creator_credit: Edward Sutherland, Douglas Fairbanks and Elton Corporation
results.brief_description: A rich playboy makes a bet that he can live on a desert island for a year without the luxuries of modern life. A satire of the classic novel by Daniel Defoe filmed on location on a Tahitian Island with Douglas Fairbanks playing an acrobatic Crusoe. Cast also includes William Farnum, Earle Browne and Maria Alba.

results.title: Out of the blue
results.creator_credit: Leigh Jason, Isadore G. Goldsmith, Eagle-Lion and Pathe Industries
results.brief_description: Hen pecked Arthur Earthliegh (George Brent) has a respite from one woman - his wife, only to end up in the arms of another, the drunken yet voracious Olive (Ann Dvorak) who accompanies him home one night. Unbeknownst to Arthur, Olive has a heart condition and Arthur, thinking he has killed her, places the body on the next door neighbour’s patio - all under the watchful eye of 2 elderly female residents who alert the police. By the time the police have arrived, next door neighbour David has decided to extort Earthliegh into helping him dispose of the body in exchange for Earthliegh dropping the case against having David and his dog, Rabelais (who is prone to digging up the Earthliegh’s zinnias) evicted. Cast also includes Carole Landis and Turhan Bey. Based on a story by Vera Caspary.

results.title: The Underneath
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, John Hardy and Populist Pictures
results.brief_description: Michael Chambers (Peter Gallagher) is a gambling addict who returns to his Texas home town to celebrate his mother’s re-marriage. The past is quick to catch up with him in the shape of his jealous brother and Rachel (Alison Elliott), a former girlfriend now married to the local ‘big man’, Tommy. Michael and Rachel rekindle their affair and soon plot to elope with the proceeds from a bank robbery. For the plan to succeed, Michael needs to involve his father-in-law to be and Susan, the bank manager who happens to be a former fling. Marking Soderbergh’s re-emergence following the early success of ‘Sex, lies and videotape’, ‘The Underneath’ combines the classic elements of film noir with an added spin on the deceptive nature of modern relationships. Filmmaker Richard Linklater and Shelley Duvall appear briefly in this film. ‘The Underneath’ is based on the novel ‘Criss Cross’ by Don Tracy. It is a faithful re-make of the film ‘Criss Cross’ directed by Robert Sidomak and starring Burt Lancaster (1948). This video is a modified version of the originally filmed in Cinemascope film.

results.title: Nana
results.brief_description: Handsomely staged adaption of Emile Zola’s celebrated novel about a Parisian coquette who becomes a music hall star. Fame and fortune bring her little happiness however, as two brothers both vie for her affections, leading to a bitter rivalry that ends in tragedy. Director Dorothy Arzner’s only film for Goldwyn also marks the debut of Russian-born actress Anna Sten in Hollywood. Cast also includes Lionel Atwill and Richard Bennett.

results.title: Happiness [Widescreen] (E)
results.creator_credit: Todd Solondz, Christine Vachon, Ted Hope, Good Machine International and Killer Films
results.brief_description: This controversial and darkly funny independent film is an examination of the alienated lives of three middle-class sisters. The eldest (Elizabeth Ashley) believes herself to be happily married and the epitome of suburban success, but she is unaware that her psychiatrist husband lusts after his son’s school-boy friends; the middle sister (Lara Flynn Boyle) is an emotionally sterile successful writer who is fascinated by the obscene phonecalls of her next door neighbour; and the youngest (Jane Adams) is an eternally optimistic hippie who maintains a Candide-like faith in her fellow humans and therefore ends up being taken advantage of by family, friends and colleagues. Populated by a cast of talented character actors, “Happiness” is a sharply scripted film that explores the break-down of family life and community. By focussing on sexual relationships that mainstream English-language cinema usually only presents as evil or extreme, the film also manages to present the underlying loneliness that leads to the bleakness and alienation of modern suburban life. In its final devastating scenes, the film also manages to convey powerfully, and unexpectedly, the importance of familial relationships. Often criticised as cynical, the reality is that in its final moments, “Happiness” reveals itself as a compassionate and moving film. Cast includes Ben Gazzara, Louise Lasser, Phillip Seymour Hoffman and Cynthia Stevenson.

results.title: Girl 6 = Girl six
results.creator_credit: Spike Lee, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks and Fox Searchlight Pictures
results.brief_description: Theresa Randle is an attractive and talented actress but her inability to find acting work leads her to get a job working as a sex-phone operator. Initially suspicious, if intrigued, by the agency she works for, she finds that her work leads to her gaining empowerment over herself and her sexuality. Spike Lee’s “Girl 6” stands as one of his most under-rated films. A clear-sighted examination of fantasy, this film features an excellent cast of women who approach their life, work and relationships with street-smart humour. It is the men around them who find themselves ultimately more repressed by the guilt and shame with which they shroud their sexual fantasies. The film also intelligently and sharply explores the contradictions of race and performance, examining how for an African-American woman the “invisibility” of voice and the phone allows for a greater opportunity of expression than when roles are circumscribed by the hue of her skin colour. This is a vibrant, entertaining and poignant film. Features cameo appearances by Madonna, Quentin Tarantino, Debi Mazar, Naomi Campbell and Halle Berry.

results.title: Limbo
results.creator_credit: John Sayles, Maggie Renzi and Green/Renzi
results.brief_description: Writer/director Sayles once again takes his audience to a place they may never have been before - both psychologically and geographically. Traumatized by a boating accident that killed two friends, Joe Gastineau (David Strathairn) has given up hope for a life beyond the odd jobs he takes to support himself. Everything changes when struggling singer Donna De Angelo (Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio) and her troubled teenage daughter enter his life. Both mother and daughter fall for Joe, increasing the already-present friction between them. The tension continues to build until Joe’s fast-talking half-brother Bobby returns to town, sparking a chain of events that will change all of their lives forever. This is an engrossing movie with engaging characters, overlaid on the extraordinary setting of the rugged Alaskan wilderness.

results.title: Vertigo [DVD]
results.brief_description: Arguably one of Hitchcock’s greatest films, “Vertigo” is a tense and riveting film about obsession, desire and betrayal. James Stewart plays a cop with a fear of heights who is hired to keep an eye on the wife (Kim Novak) of an old friend. He falls in love with her, and her tragic death haunts him until he meets another woman who reminds him of her. His obsession with remodelling his new love into the image of the dead woman leads him further and further into a sinister nightmare world in which nothing and no-one is who they seem. With Barbara Bel Geddes and ravishing production credits. Based on “D’Entre les Mortes” by Pierre Boileau and Thomas Narcejac.

results.title: Midnight express [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, David Puttnam and Casablanca Films
results.brief_description: A young tourist, Billy Hayes (Brad Davis), travelling in Turkey is arrested for possession of hashish. The film traces his experiences, often violent and terrifying, in a foreign jail and his attempts to escape and cross the border into freedom. The cast also features John Hurt and Randy Quaid with a script by Oliver Stone. The film is based on Billy Hughes’ book of the same title relating his jail experiences.
